content.text:
# 16th Costume Designers Guild Awards

| location      = The Beverly Hilton, Beverly Hills, California
| country       = United States
| presenter     = Costume Designers Guild
| host          = Joshua Malina
| award1_type   = Excellence in Contemporary Film:
| award1_winner = Blue Jasmine – Suzy Benzinger
| award2_type   = Excellence in Fantasy Film:
| award2_winner = The Hunger Games: Catching Fire – Trish Summerville
| award3_type   = Excellence in Period Film:
| award3_winner = 12 Years a Slave – Patricia Norris
| previous      = 15th
| main          = CDG Awards
| next          = 17th
}}
The 16th Costume Designers Guild Awards, honoring the best costume designs in film, television, and media for 2013, was held on February 22, 2014. The nominees were announced on January 8, 2014.
Winners and nominees
The winners are in bold.
Film
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!style="width=50%"|Excellence in Contemporary Film
!style="width=50%"|Excellence in Period Film
|-
| valign="top" |
*'Blue Jasmine – Suzy Benzinger'
**Her – Casey Storm
**Nebraska – Wendy Chuck
**Philomena – Consolata Boyle
**The Secret Life of Walter Mitty – Sarah Edwards
| valign="top" |
*'12 Years a Slave – Patricia Norris'
**American Hustle – Michael Wilkinson
**Dallas Buyers Club – Kurt & Bart
**The Great Gatsby – Catherine Martin
**Saving Mr. Banks – Daniel Orlandi
|-
!style="width=50%" colspan="2"|Excellence in Fantasy Film
|-
|valign="top" colspan="2"|
*'The Hunger Games: Catching Fire – Trish Summerville'
**The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug – Bob Buck, Ann Maskrey and Richard Taylor
**Oz the Great and Powerful – Gary Jones and Michael Kutsche
|}
Television
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!style="width=50%"|Outstanding Contemporary Television
!style="width=50%"|Outstanding Period/Fantasy Television
|-
| valign="top"|
*'House of Cards – Tom Broecker'
**Breaking Bad – Jennifer L. Bryan
**Nashville – Susie DeSanto
**Saturday Night Live – Tom Broecker and Eric Justian
**Scandal – Lyn Paolo
| valign="top"|
*'Downton Abbey – Caroline McCall'
**Boardwalk Empire – John Dunn and Lisa Padovani
**The Borgias – Gabriella Pescucci
**Game of Thrones – Michele Clapton
**Mad Men – Janie Bryant
|-
!style="width=50%" colspan="2"|Outstanding Made for Television Movie or Miniseries
|-
|valign="top" colspan="2"|
*'Behind the Candelabra – Ellen Mirojnick'
**American Horror Story: Coven – Lou Eyrich
**Bonnie & Clyde – Marilyn Vance
**House of Versace – Claire Nadon
**Phil Spector – Debra McGuire
|}
Commercial
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!Excellence in Commercial Design
|-
| valign="top"|
*Call of Duty: "Ghosts Masked Warriors" – Nancy Steiner
**Dos Equis: "The Most Interesting Man in the World Feeds a Bear" – Julie Vogel
**Fiat "British Invasion" – Donna Zakowska
|}
Special Awards
Career Achievement Award
* April Ferry
LACOSTE Spotlight Award
* Amy Adams
Distinguished Collaborator Award
* Judd Apatow
Distinguished Service Award
* Sharon Day
